intro: Fimbristylis elata, commonly known as the tall flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the world. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. This species is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Fimbristylis elata thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along waterways. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
